channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for RI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for RI

item.title: Report I-2023100034
item.description:
Report I-2023100034

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: Hebron
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During unloading operation consignee employees connected hose to storage tank that did not have the capacity for the load. Storage tank high level sensor failed to operate resulting in overfill of the storage tank. Consignee halted operation and connected unloading hose to secondary storage tank to complete unloading. Plant personnel cleaned up released material from tank area.

item.title: Report X-2023100474
item.description:
Report X-2023100474

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: WARWICK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKER IN THE UNLOAD AT DOOR 7. THERE WERE 5 GALLON CONTAINERS IN THE IRREG CHUTE. THE CONTAINERS HAD CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS AND SHIPPING PAPERS. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND BROUGHT THE CONTAINERS BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report I-2023100033
item.description:
Report I-2023100033

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: Butler
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At the end of the unloading operation, the flange on the loading line failed causing a slight leak. Unloading completed and CTMV returned to shipper for repair. Clean up done by consignee plant employees.
